poem:
Title: "In Flickers of High Society"

Katlo dances, glee abrim
upon the stage—oh, Puckish Dinah,
trapped in the limelight of love.
The heart's jest ringing loud
in a film of sparkling yesteryear.
Ice clinks in glasses—laughter fizzles.
Grace, Bing, and Frank croon and sway,
notes of Porter's bittersweet symphony.
Life's game played in high society,
love always the glittering prize.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "High Society review – a fizzing cocktail of comedy, Cole Porter and emotion In the game of life, what matters most? According to Dinah (the only child in this story, played with Puckish glee by Katlo), “being in love”. Arthur Kopit’s 1998 stage version of the 1956 film musical High Society (starring Grace Kelly, Bing Crosby and Frank Sinatra, with music and lyrics by Cole Porter) keeps the sparkling lightness of the film but adds". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
